definition: to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important

sentences.english: Sometimes really ambiguous entries make it on the list because I trust my future self way too much.
sentences.chinese: 有時，我寫下含糊不清的條目，這是自視甚高。

sentences.english: Fashion takes itself way too seriously and has a sense of exclusivity.
sentences.chinese: 時尚界自視過高，具有一種排他感。

sentences.english: No one feels comfortable around a prima do a.
sentences.chinese: 跟自視甚高的人在一起，沒有人會感覺舒服。

sentences.english: She has a high self-esteem, and sees herself as a people person.
sentences.chinese: 她自視甚高，認爲自己擅長與人打交道。

sentences.english: People should respect himself, and should be able noblest thing worthy of self-regard.
sentences.chinese: 人應尊敬他自己，並應自視能配得上最高尚的東西。

sentences.english: She considers herself too elevated to eat in a fast-food restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 她自視太下，沒有肯正在快餐店用餐。

sentences.english: And most of all, I will laugh at myself for man is most comical when he takes himself too seriously.
sentences.chinese: 我笑自己，由於自視甚高的人往往顯得滑稽。

sentences.english: Unworthiness and a poor self-image are really just a case of mistaken identity.
sentences.chinese: 自視甚低實際上是一種錯誤的自我認知。

sentences.english: No one feels comfortable around a prima donna.
sentences.chinese: 跟自視甚高的人在一起，沒有人會感覺舒服。

sentences.english: He fancies himself, hoping to get that job.
sentences.chinese: 他自視甚高，竟想得到那份工作。

sentences.english: The haughty man thinks highly of himself while holding others in contempt .
sentences.chinese: 那傲慢的人自視甚高，而藐視別人。
